org.apache.karaf.main.lock

Class GenericStatements

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.karaf.main.lock.GenericStatements

  • public class GenericStatements
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is used to create the sql statements for the Karaf lock tables that are used for clustering of Karaf instances.

    It will generate sql statement to create two separate tables, a lock table and a lock id table:

    CREATE TABLE LOCK ( ID INTEGER DEFAULT 0, STATE INTEGER DEFAULT 0, LOCK_DELAY INTEGER DEFAULT 0 ) CREATE TABLE LOCK_ID ( ID INTEGER DEFAULT 0 )

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenericStatements(java.lang.String lockTableName, java.lang.String lockIdTableName, java.lang.String clusterName)
      This constructor is used to determine the name of the Karaf lock table, the Karaf lock id table and the name of the clustered instances.

      • GenericStatements

        public GenericStatements(java.lang.String lockTableName,
                         java.lang.String lockIdTableName,
                         java.lang.String clusterName)
        This constructor is used to determine the name of the Karaf lock table, the Karaf lock id table and the name of the clustered instances.
        Parameters:
        lockTableName - The name of the karaf lock table.
        lockIdTableName - The name of the karaf lock id table.
        clusterName - the name of the cluster being used.

    • Method Detail

      • getNodeName

        public final java.lang.String getNodeName()
        This method will return the name of the cluster that the instances are using to compete for the master lock.
        Returns:
        The cluster node name.

      • getLockUpdateIdStatement

        public java.lang.String getLockUpdateIdStatement(int id,
                                                 int state,
                                                 int lock_delay,
                                                 int curId)
        This will be called when trying to acquire the lock and will generate the following sql statement. UPDATE KARAF_LOCK SET ID = ?, STATE = ?, LOCK_DELAY = ? WHERE ID = 0 OR ID = ? You are then expected to assign the values associated with the sql statement.
        Parameters:
        id - The new ID.
        state - The new lock state.
        lock_delay - The new lock delay.
        curId - The current ID.
        Returns:
        The SQL update statement.

      • getLockUpdateIdStatementToStealLock

        public java.lang.String getLockUpdateIdStatementToStealLock(int id,
                                                            int state,
                                                            int lock_delay,
                                                            int curId,
                                                            int curState)
        This will be called when trying to steal the lock and will generate the following sql statement. UPDATE KARAF_LOCK SET ID = ?, STATE = ?, LOCK_DELAY = ? WHERE ( ID = 0 OR ID = ? ) AND STATE = ? You are then responsible to assign the values of the different fields using standard JDBC statement calls.
        Parameters:
        id - The new ID.
        state - The new lock state.
        lock_delay - The new lock delay.
        curId - The current ID.
        curState - The current state.
        Returns:
        The SQL update statement.

      • getLockResetIdStatement

        public java.lang.String getLockResetIdStatement(int id)
        This method is called only when we are releasing the lock and will generate the following sql statement. UPDATE KARAF_LOCK SET ID = 0 WHERE ID = ?
        Parameters:
        id - The current ID.
        Returns:
        sql update statement

      • getLockSelectStatement

        public java.lang.String getLockSelectStatement()
        This will be called to determine the current master instance for the lock table and will generate the following sql statement. SELECT ID, STATE, LOCK_DELAY FROM KARAF_LOCK
        Returns:
        sql select statement
